overview:
Having graduated from Franklin W. Olin College of Engineering in 2010 with a degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering, William received a world-class education in design, problem solving, and teamwork. After working with a number of industry leaders, helping to further their core technologies, and countless group projects at Olin, William is now working to solve further challenging problems for his clients through Deterministic Programming.

William has been honored in national competitions in mathematics (at ARML) and musical performance (on tuba). He has developed technologies for enterprises from San Francisco to New York to Boston.

Olin College, recently named one of the New Ivy’s by Newsweek, had given a full merit-based scholarship to all incoming students. It is an institution with an ambitious mission statement: “Olin College prepares future leaders through an innovative engineering education that bridges science and technology, enterprise, and society. Skilled in independent learning and the art of design, our graduates will seek opportunities and take initiative to make a positive difference in the world.”
